data.title: Excellent History of Route 66
data.text: We went along when they had a car show on and it was fabulous So many memories and cars to see What is even better is that it is free to look around and contributions are voluntary.  What a brilliant place to visit

data.title: Great Little Museum
data.text:
We've done the Vegas to LA drive a few times, and we were looking for something to break up the drive a bit - and thought we'd pay this museum a visit, with little idea of what to expect.

As it turns out, it was a great little detour (it's very close to the freeway). The museum was fun, with some nice exhibits. The volunteers were extremely friendly and I enjoyed chatting to them.

I would definitely recommend a visit - but do check the opening hours in advance. The museum is operated by volunteers, and is not open every day.

data.title: SERIOUSLY FUN SMALL ROADSIDE ATTRACTION
data.text:
The California Route 66 Museum is one of those hidden gems that will thrill history buffs and kids alike. It's a small museum that could be easily lost of if you didn't know about it. It's just off the I-15 in old Town Victorville. It's an easy detour on your way to/from Las Vegas and Los Angeles.

I was greeted by a cheerful lady named Cathy who explained the museum to me and told me a bit of the history of the museum. Everything is donated and there is no admission. She encouraged me to make a purchase in the fun store as a way to help the museum. 

This is a small museum in 3 rooms or so. It is crammed with fun items pertaining to Route 66 and life in the heyday of this iconic road that crossed the USA. I know that Europeans have a particular fondness for Route 66. I guess it's their idea of living the American dream. The guests before me that day were from Slovakia and Sweden so people do make a special effort to visit this museum.

Step behind the front of a Volkswagen van to have you picture taken in the 1960's Free Lover but the big treat of this museum is the 1917 Ford Model T Truck. Yes, you can climb aboard and have your picture taken behind the wheel. How many times does one get to go INSIDE a Model T? This fun adventure makes the museum well worth the visit.

The rooms are filled with historical memorabilia and information on the days gone by of Route 66. Although it may not be a must-see and go out of your way to see museum, it is worth the visit if you are passing by Victorville, California. It's an easy detour from the I-15. Spend 15 minutes or spend 2 hours. You will get your kicks on Route 66.

data.title: Your Time Line or Mine?
data.text: This Museum is such a fantastic place, really takes you back in time. Especially if you've ever driven it. Will return with different guest and friends.

data.title: fun
data.text: Stopped by with visiting family (all adults) and we had a nice time, the museum is small but clean and interactive, a lot of history to be learned.  There are volunteers with much information or you can just walk around and read the history for yourself.  There is a VW Bus front end (from the 60's) in which you can take pictures (wigs, glasses, etc..provided).  Hats, t-shirts, magnets and much more available to purchase, this is a non-profit, so please do so!

data.title: MUST SEE!!!
data.text: We loved this museum!! So much history of Route 66 packed into this one place!! The curator was also very knowledgable and truly enjoyed what he did for the museum and the people that came through!!

data.title: AMAZING COLLECTION OF HISTORIC ROUTE 66
data.text: For those who love to see things of the past, especially regarding Route 66, this is the place to visit!  There are so many items that a lot of time can be spent here to really see each and every item!  This museum will bring back many memories for the older generations and bring out the curiosity of the younger generation.  Our 10-year-old grandson had a wonderful time exploring this museum.  We highly recommend visiting any Route 66 Museum!  Although admittance is free, DONATIONS ARE WELCOMED!

data.title: The museum staff are very interesting folks, friendly and knowledgeable.
data.text: The museum is very small, but not hard to miss, off the Route 66. Charming, has several very interesting displays of cars, gas stations, and such. A brief and cute history about the famous Route 66 - and a rather gift store for memorabilia. Worth stopping in for an hour or so.

data.title: Blast from the past
data.text: This was a fun museum to walk thru. You know you are getting old when the stuff in the museum looks like stuff from your childhood! Nice photo ops inside the museum too. The admission is free.  Nice place to spend an hour and look around.

data.title: Amazing. A must stop place to visit,
data.text: The California Route 66 Museum is just amazing. The history of the mother road and also included is some history about the local area and how the road and Victorville joined hands. The staff is very friendly and eager to answer any questions you may have. On the wall is a map of travelers that have visited the museum, they get at place a pin on the map where they are from and people from all over the world has visited. If in the area this is a must stop.

data.title: Nostalgic dive into the history of Route 66
data.text: The exhibits take you back in time. There is even an old Ford Model T and an old telephone switchboard. The staff were very friendly and we had a very nice chat about the history of Route 66. Entry is free and there is a great little gift shop with nice Route 66 souvenirs.

data.title: Cute Little Museum
data.text: This museum is very cool! There are old cars that you can take pictures in, and other sets. The museum staff are very friendly as well!

data.title: Route 66 Museum - Victorville
data.text: If traveling thru Victorville take the time this important piece of history. Route 66 opened the expansion from the Midwest to California. Interesting looking at the memorable part of USA history.

data.title: A bit of American History
data.text:
We drove down a really short bit of Route 66 on our way from Las Vegas to Los Angeles and say this in our guide book so made an effort to stop. It was great and there was just so much to see it was a shame we weren't able to spend longer there.

The staff were also so friendly and were chatting away about all sorts - a really fascinating stop. I highly recommend you make the effort to head there (especially as it's free entry), even if it does end up being slightly out of your way. It feels like a real piece of American History - and I think for many people what they imagine of a town along Historic Route 66!

data.title: Great!!
data.text: If you live in the Victor Valley or are doing Route 66 this is a nice place to spend some time. Many displays, helpful volunteers. Very enjoyable.

data.title: Piece of History
data.text: After leaving LA on Highway 15 I stopped off for a break and to see a part of Route 66 on the way to Vegas. It was good to see a range of artefacts mixed in with local business. It's a nice stop to stretch the legs  for 5 minutes

data.title: Trip down memory lane=worth a stop
data.text: Found this museum through TripAdvisor. Worth a stop. Friendly staff and it's free! iT'Z a museum packed with lots of  historical memorabilia. Very comfortable, great photo-ops. Friendly volunteers! Consider supporting them by buying something in the gift shop, plenty of cute things. On our visit today there were  guests from France and Lithuania!

data.title: Absolutely Worth A Stop
data.text:
Fun place to visit. Interesting memorabilia. Fascinating history of Route 66. Great
photo ops. 
You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Briliiant Museum and awesome ladies who organised this for our group
data.text: Special thanks to the ladies who opened up the museum to our group on a Tuesday when its not normally open. Our whole group really enjoyed the displays and were very impressed by the visit. Well worth a stop, thanks again!!

data.title: This attraction is FREE entry.
data.text:
The Museum is pretty neat.  
The staff super nice, friendly. 
Very interesting lots to look at and read. 
They have a lot of memorabilia most donated to the Museum. 
A movie with more history. 
I feel like I looked at everything and read a lot and watched the movie in maybe 1 1/2 hours.  
They have a gift shop, free parking. 
They suggest Donations. 
Staff volunteer.  

I would recommend.
